column4: would anyone be willing to give me a little fstab editing verification?  I am trying to edit fstab for the first time and am not sure I have the format down right
--> http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=283131
to copy in the terminal you need shift+ctrl+c
no dice... just see's it as a ctrl+c
I dont know shift+ctrl+c always works for me
I have ubuntu 9.04 64bit edition, java works for me. I can take a look at my ff profile and see what it using if you wish
can you go here and tell me if it asks you to install a plugin?  http://www.javatester.org/version.html
yes, it works for me --> Java Version 1.6.0_13 from Sun Microsystems Inc.

thank you.  Did you have to do anything special to get java working?  I remember when first getting java 64 bit to work under 8.10 I had to follow this:  [edit: ff just froze... will post link when resolved]
no, but I'm using a laptop I purchased from System76 with ubuntu 9.04 64bit already installed
ah, so it came pre-installed.  ok, thanks for the help :)... i'll figure this out :)
what do have at /usr/lib/jvm/
that might be my problem... I have a link called javaws... but no jvm directory
I have to ask, have you tried going to a flash site and downloading it from there when prompted?
just downloaded the sun(tm) java plugin for ff off the java taster pae
at the command line what does   java -version   give you?

not sure if this will help but this is what I have -->   java version "1.6.0_13"   Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_13-b03)   Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.3-b02, mixed mode)
looks like we have the same thing now
so it works for you now?
getting closer :)... for some reason still says browser has java disabled
yeah, restart ff and see if that helps
do you have   /opt/java/64/jre1.6.0_14/lib/amd64/libnpjp2.so

you rock!... I had that plugin but it was disabled... I didn't recognize it at all so didn't enable it.  Didn't realize it was java.  I turned it on and now have a little dancing javaman on the http://java.com/en/download/help/testvm.xml site.  THANKS!
cool, no problem, glad its working
